metadata.name: Uncommon File Creation By Mysql Daemon Process
metadata.comment: Detects the creation of files with scripting or executable extensions by Mysql daemon. Which could be an indicator of "User Defined Functions" abuse to download malware.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(actor.process.name), lower('\\mysqld.exe')) OR endswith(lower(actor.process.name), lower('\\mysqld-nt.exe'))) AND (endswith(lower(file.path), lower('.bat')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('.dat')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('.dll')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('.exe')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('.ps1')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('.psm1')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('.vbe')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('.vbs'))))

output.summary: Detects the creation of files with scripting or executable extensions by Mysql daemon. Which could be an indicator of "User Defined Functions" abuse to download malware.
